abstract: Facebook, the most successful start-up of the last decade, is only six years old, and an initial public offering is still a way off. But a number of Facebook’s early employees are giving up their stable jobs, free food and laundry service to build their own businesses.
snippet: Facebook, the most successful start-up of the last decade, is only six years old, and an initial public offering is still a way off. But a number of Facebook’s early employees are giving up their stable jobs, free food and laundry service to build...
lead_paragraph: Facebook, the most successful start-up of the last decade, is only six years old, and an initial public offering is still a way off, Verne G. Kopytoff reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Facebook’s Early Employees Are Moving On
